# Building JavaScript Apps with API Data
---

Hello, [Wrold](https://medium.com/@the_taqquikarim/console-log-hello-wrold-3e3abeb44396#.vk701xxec)! Welcome to Javascript APIs.

### Objective
---
Our main today is to learn how we can leverage 3rd party APIs to enrich our webpages with dynamic data.

We will cover **public APIs** only, since those don't require anything more than some js code to configure. This means we will **not** talk about the twitter or facebook APIs which require a user authentication component to work correctly.

### Game Plan
---

#### Warm-up: Simple GET requests
The assumption is you've probably worked with API data before. Even if you have not, with jQuery, it's literally just 4 or 5 lines of code to get started.

#### Wrangling Asynchronousness: Dealing with multiple requests
How do we force asynchronous requests to execute in order?

#### Exploring RESTful APIs: What is REST? 
We have a good handle on GET requests, but what about all the other types? Specifically POST, PUT, DELETE?

#### Promises: Handling asynchronous requests
What are promises and how can we use them to make it easier for us to draw data together from multiple sources?
